text: Léon Bel (July 28, 1878 – July 19, 1957) was a French businessman. ==Early life== Léon Bel was born on July 28, 1878 in Orgelet in rural France.Léon Bel, GeneaNet His father, Jules Bel, was a cheese maker who created the Bel Group.Elsa Bembaron, La Vache qui rit, héroïne de la Première Guerre mondiale, Le Figaro, August 10, 2012 He served in the French Army during World War I. ==Career== Bel took over the Bel Group from his father. With Swiss cheese makers, he learned how to make cheese that would keep. In 1921, he launched the brand known as The Laughing Cow. ==Death== He died on July 19, 1957 in Paris, France. ==References== Category:1878 births Category:1957 deaths Category:People from Franche-Comté Category:People from Paris Category:Cheesemakers Category:French military personnel of World War I
